戒.definition: to guard against; to exhort; to admonish or warn; to give up or stop doing sth; Buddhist monastic discipline; ring (for a finger)

戒備.definition: to take precautions; to guard against (emergency)

戒刀.definition: Buddhist monk's knife (not used for killing)

戒嚴.definition: to impose martial law; to impose emergency measures

戒嚴區.definition: restricted area; zone of application of the martial law

戒壇.definition: ordination platform in a Buddhist temple

戒奢崇儉.definition: (idiom) to refrain from extravagance and cherish frugality

戒忌.definition: a taboo; to avoid sth (as taboo)

戒斷.definition: to quit (taking drugs, alcohol etc); withdrawal

戒毒.definition: to kick a drug habit; to abstain from drugs

戒牒.definition: Buddhist or Taoist ordination certificate issued by monastic authorities

戒絕.definition: abstinence; to give up (a bad habit)

戒行.definition: (Buddhism) to adhere strictly to the ethical precepts; asceticism

戒酒.definition: to give up drinking; to abstain from drinking

戒除.definition: to quit; to give up (a bad habit)

戒驕戒躁.definition: to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
